author: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
Teoderick Contreras
description: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: The following analytic detects the use of the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to hijack or hook library functions on a Linux platform. It leverages data from Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents, focusing on process execution logs that include command-line details. This activity is significant because adversaries, malware authors, and red teamers commonly use this technique to gain elevated privileges and establish persistence on a compromised machine. If confirmed malicious, this behavior could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code, escalate privileges, and maintain long-term access to the system. This rule was converted with Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001.
false_positives: Administrator or network operator can execute this command. Please update the filter macros to remove false positives.
name: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: Linux Preload Hijack Library Calls
note: The following analytic detects the use of the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to hijack or hook library functions on a Linux platform. It leverages data from Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents, focusing on process execution logs that include command-line details. This activity is significant because adversaries, malware authors, and red teamers commonly use this technique to gain elevated privileges and establish persistence on a compromised machine. If confirmed malicious, this behavior could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code, escalate privileges, and maintain long-term access to the system.
query:
sequence by process.entity_id
  [process where process.name == "ld-linux.so" and process.args == "--preload"]
  [process where process.args == "LD_PRELOAD" and process.args != null]
